{{Infobox company | name = Korte Company | logo = File:Korte.png | logo_alt = The Korte company logo | logo_caption = The Korte Company logo, 2006 | former_name = Ralph Korte Construction | type = Privately held company | industry = design-build, construction management, consulting | founded = 1958 | founder = Ralph Korte | hq_location = Illinois | key_people = Todd Korte, [[CEO]] }}
'''The Korte Company''', founded in 1958, specializes in [[design-build]], construction management and construction services, and is headquartered in [[Highland, Illinois]], with additional offices in [[St. Louis, Missouri]], [[Norman, Oklahoma]], and [[Las Vegas, Nevada]]. The firm’s project expertise includes the design and construction of warehouse/distribution centers, religious facilities, commercial buildings, schools, recreation centers, office complexes, as well as a variety of projects for federal, state and local government agencies. The Korte Company manages, on average, an excess of $330 million in annual construction volume.
The Korte Company has been considered a pioneer through the late 20th century through new construction methods such as [[Tilt slab]] construction and design-build-furnish construction. The company is now run by Ralph Korte's son, Todd Korte. Ralph Korte still remains as a consultant and chairman of the [[board of directors]].
== Timeline == [[Image:KorteOriginal.jpg|thumb|Korte Construction Original Logo]] * 1958 - The Korte Company, then named "Korte Construction", was created after [[Ralph Korte]] was approached to build a milking parlor near [[Pierron, IL]]. * 1968 - Official [[headquarters]] opened in [[Highland, Illinois]] * 1977 - First ConSteel Tilt-Up Building in [[Highland, Illinois]] * 1981 - Korte Interiors division created * 1986 - [[Headquarters]] moves to [[St. Louis Union Station]] in [[St. Louis, Missouri]] * 2000 - Name changes from "Korte Construction" to "The Korte Company"
== CEOs == * Ralph Korte - 1958 though 1987 * Vern Eardley - 1987 though 2000 * Todd Korte - 2000 to present
== Todd Korte == Todd Korte is the current [[president#Non-governmental_presidents|president]] and CEO of The Korte Company. Born in 1967, he is the son of The Korte Company's founder, [[Ralph Korte]]. He started at The Korte Company in 1981 as a [[warehouse]] worker. In 1989 he earned his [[bachelor's degree]] in construction science from [[Kansas State University]]. <ref>{{cite web | last = Kipp | first = Kevin | title = Korte Kin | work = St. Louis Commerce Magazine | date = October 2001 | url = http://www.stlcommercemagazine.com/archives/october2001/cover.html | accessdate = 2015-07-03 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120213195652/http://www.stlcommercemagazine.com/archives/october2001/cover.html | archivedate=2012-02-13}}</ref>
== Awards == * Achievement Award, American Institute of Architects, 1/1/2005 <ref>{{cite web | title = AIA Southern Illinois 2005 Design Award Winners | date = 2006-02-17 | url =http://www.aiasi.org/awards-2005.html | accessdate = 2007-01-03 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20061206042536/http://www.aiasi.org/awards-2005.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2006-12-06}}</ref> * St. Louis RCGA Top 50 Businesses Award, St. Louis RCGA, 12/9/2005 <ref>{{cite web | title = Greater St. Louis Top 50 Awards | date = 2005-12-09 | url = http://www.stlrcga.org/x1300.xml | accessdate = 2007-01-05 }}</ref>
== Notes == <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.korteco.com The Korte Company]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Korte Company, The}} [[Category:Construction and civil engineering companies of the United States]] [[Category:Privately held companies of the United States]] [[Category:Companies based in Illinois]] [[Category:Construction industry]] [[Category:Commercial buildings]]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name = Thomas Orbos |image = Thomas Orbos 2016.jpg |image_size = 220px |caption = Orbos in 2016 |office =[[Chairman of the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority|Officer-in-Charge of the]] [[Metropolitan Manila Development Authority]] |president = [[Rodrigo Roa Duterte]] |term_start = August 22, 2016 |term_end = May 21, 2017 |predecessor = [[Emerson Carlos]] |successor = [[Danilo Lim]] |office1 =General Manager of the [[Metropolitan Manila Development Authority]] |president1 = [[Rodrigo Roa Duterte]] |term_start1 = August 22, 2016 |term_end1 =February 19, 2018 |predecessor1 = Corazon Jimenez |successor1 =Jose Arturo Garcia | office2 = Assistant General Manager for Planning of the [[Metropolitan Manila Development Authority]] | president2 = [[Benigno S. Aquino III]] | term_start2 = June 9, 2014 | term_end2 = August 19, 2016 | succeeding2 = | predecessor2 = Tina Velasco | successor2 = Maria Josefina Faulan |Alma_matter = Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Sloan School Of Management |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |nationality = |party = |spouse = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = Massachusetts Institute Of Technology, Sloan School Of Management |occupation = |profession = |religion = |signature = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Thomas "Tim" Muñoz Orbos''' is a Filipino businessman, government administrator and politician who was General Manager of the [[Metropolitan Manila Development Authority]] (MMDA) and Undersecretary for Road Transport and Infrastructure of the [[Department of Transportation (Philippines)|Department of Transportation]] under the administration of President [[Rodrigo Duterte]].{{cite web|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/05/21/duterte-appoints-danny-lim-as-new-mmda-chair.html |title=Duterte appoints Danny Lim as new MMDA char |publisher=[[CNN Philippines]] |author=Marcelo, V. |date=22 May 2017 |accessdate=23 May 2017}} He also served as MMDA's acting chairman following the resignation of [[Emerson Carlos]] on August 19, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/808603/carlos-leaves-mmda-orbos-takes-over |title=Carlos leaves MMDA; Orbos takes over |publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] |author=Yee, J. |date=23 August 2016 |accessdate=25 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.philstar.com/nation/2016/08/22/1616164/acting-mmda-chief-steps-down-2-days-duterte-order |title=Acting MMDA chief steps down 2 days before Duterte order |publisher=[[The Philippine Star]] |author=Frialde, M. |date=22 August 2016 |accessdate=25 September 2016}} Orbos previously held the position of MMDA Assistant General Manager for Planning under then President [[Benigno Aquino III]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/president-duterte-administers-oaths-of-office-to-43-new-appointees/ |title=President Duterte administers oath of office to 43 new appointees |publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]] |author=Philippine News Agency |date=12 September 2016 |accessdate=25 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mmda.gov.ph/index.php/33-gallery-2014/1143-oath-taking-of-agm-thomas-orbos-june-9-2014 |title=Oath Taking of AGM Thomas Orbos – June 9, 2014 |publisher=[[Metropolitan Manila Development Authority]] |accessdate=25 September 2016}} Orbos hails from the province of [[Pangasinan]] and is the brother of former Executive Secretary and Congressman [[Oscar Orbos]], as well as popular priest and [[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] columnist Fr. Jerry Orbos.{{cite web|url=http://thestandard.com.ph/news/-main-stories/top-stories/215278/mmda-learns-from-fvr.html |title=MMDA learns from FVR |publisher=[[The Standard (Philippines)|The Standard]] |author=Philippine News Agency |date=5 September 2016 |accessdate=25 September 2016}} He has also previously worked as Undersecretary for the Office of the President and owned several businesses in the past including the Pangasinan Presidents (later renamed Pangasinan Waves) franchise team in the now-defunct [[Metropolitan Basketball Association]].{{cite web|url=http://www.philstar.com/sports/146552/tuason-welcomes-back-orbos-group-mba |title=Tuason welcomes back Orbos group to MBA |publisher=[[The Philippine Star]] |author=Villar, J. |date=10 January 2002 |accessdate=25 September 2016}} He is also an alumnus from Massachusetts Institute Of Technology, Sloan School of Management. Orbos, as of October 2018, is running for a congressional seat representing the [[Legislative districts of Pangasinan#1st District|1st District]] of [[Pangasinan]], a post formerly headed by his brother.{{Cite news|url=http://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1051502|title=46 bets file CoCs in Pangasinan|last=Yparraguirre|first=Liwayway|date=October 18, 2018|work=[[Philippine News Agency]]|access-date=October 19, 2018}} He is running under the [[PDP–Laban]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1051496|title=DOTr undersecretary eyes Pangasinan 1st district post|last=Pasion|first=Ahikam|date=October 18, 2018|work=[[Philippine News Agency]]|access-date=October 19, 2018}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before= [[Emerson Carlos]]
{{small|Acting}}}} {{s-ttl|title= Chairman of the [[Metropolitan Manila Development Authority ]]|years=2016–2017}} {{s-aft|after=[[Danilo Lim]]}} {{s-end}} {{Chairpersons of MMDA}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Orbos, Thomas}} [[Category:Filipino businesspeople]] [[Category:Filipino sports executives and administrators]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chairpersons of the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority]] [[Category:Duterte Administration personnel]] [[Category:Benigno Aquino III Administration personnel]] [[Category:People from Pangasinan]]

{{Infobox person | name = Tinsley Mortimer | image = Tinsley Mortimer at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week.jpg | image_size = 200px | caption = Mortimer at [[New York Fashion Week|Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week]] for the [[Custo Barcelona]] show | birth_name = Tinsley Randolph Mercer | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1975|08|11}} | birth_place = [[South Carolina]] | known_for = ''[[The Real Housewives of New York City]]'' | education = [[St. Catherine's School (Richmond, Virginia)|St. Catherine's School]]
[[Lawrenceville School]] | alma_mater = [[Columbia University]] | height = | parents = George Riley Mercer Jr.
Dale Tatum | spouse = Robert Livingston Mortimer (m. 2002 div. 2010) | children = | relatives = }} '''Tinsley Randolph Mortimer''' (née '''Mercer'''; born August 11, 1975) is an American [[socialite]] and television personality. ==Early life== Mortimer was born in [[Richmond, Virginia]],Heyman p. 4 where she grew up, attending [[St. Catherine's School (Richmond, Virginia)|St. Catherine's School]]. Her father was George Riley Mercer Jr., a wealthy real-estate investor, and her mother is Dale Mercer (née Tatum), an interior designer.[https://www.nytimes.com/2002/05/05/style/weddings-tinsley-mercer-topper-mortimer.html "WEDDINGS; Tinsley Mercer, Topper Mortimer"], ''The New York Times'', May 5, 2002. Accessed March 16, 2012. Her paternal grandfather, George Riley Mercer Sr., founded Mercer Rug Cleansing in 1936.[http://www.mercerrugcleansing.com/about.nxg Mercerrugcleansing.com] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100119072224/http://www.mercerrugcleansing.com/about.nxg |date=2010-01-19 }} She grew up with one sister, Dabney Mercer. Mortimer attended the [[Lawrenceville School]], where she was a member of the Kirby House. She went to the [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]] as a freshman in college, but shortly dropped out of Chapel Hill to attend [[Columbia University]]. While waiting to be accepted at Columbia, she worked as a volunteer for a year at Habitat for Humanity in [[Washington, D.C.|Washington, D.C]]. At Columbia, she was a member of [[St. Anthony Hall]].[http://gawker.com/news/how-your-hegemony-gets-made/attention-tinsley-mortimer-your-frat-is-looking-for-you-273131.php Gawker] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080310190427/http://gawker.com/news/how-your-hegemony-gets-made/attention-tinsley-mortimer-your-frat-is-looking-for-you-273131.php |date=2008-03-10 }} She graduated from Columbia with a BA in art history. ==Career== Early in her career, Mortimer worked as a beauty editor at ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'' and an event planner for Harrison & Shriftman.{{Cite news|url=https://www.refinery29.com/2017/03/148105/who-is-tinsley-mortimer-rhony-season-9#slide-6|title=The Dramatic Life Story Of The Newest "RHONY" Star|access-date=2018-09-20|language=en}} Mortimer has a line of handbags and clothing in [[Japan]] for [[Samantha Thavasa]], for which she was featured in an advertising campaign.Friedman, Molly. [http://nymag.com/news/intelligencer/22328/ Tinsley Mortimer Exported to Japan], ''New York Magazine'', October 8, 2006. Accessed March 2, 2010.Brydson, Nicole. [http://www.observer.com/ Hamptons!], ''The Observer'', September 11, 2007. Accessed March 2, 2010. She also features prominently in Samantha Thavasa USA's online promotional materials and in the company's [[Madison Avenue]] store, which also carries her handbags. She subsequently formed her own clothing line, Riccime by Tinsley Mortimer, which was sold exclusively in Japan.{{Cite web|url=http://www.tinsleymortimer.com/biography/|title=About Tinsley {{!}} Tinsley Mortimer|website=www.tinsleymortimer.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-20}} In 2008, Mortimer became involved in branding and design for a condominium development.Barbanel, Josh. [https://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/23/realestate/23deal1.html?_r=1&scp=1&sq=tinsley+mortimer&st=nyt&oref=login A Socialite Dons a New Title], ''The New York Times'', March 23, 2008. Accessed March 2, 2010. Mortimer has served as [[Christian Dior]]’s beauty ambassador and helped to create a lip gloss called "Tinsley Pink".{{Cite news|url=https://www.refinery29.com/2017/03/148105/who-is-tinsley-mortimer-rhony-season-9#slide-13|title=The Dramatic Life Story Of The Newest "RHONY" Star|access-date=2018-09-20|language=en}} She has appeared on several magazine editorials, including ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'', ''[[WWD MAGAZINE|WWD]]'', ''[[Harper's Bazaar|Harper’s Bazaar]]'' and ''[[Marie Claire]].'' In May 2012, she appeared on the cover of ''Vestal'' magazine, which also featured an editorial styled by [[Lo'renzo Hill-White]] and shot by fashion photographer Kevin Sinclair.http://www.trendhunter.com/trends/t-vestal She made a cameo appearance on the season two premiere episode of ''[[Gossip Girl]]'',[http://www.gossipgirlinsider.com/gallery/tinsley-mortimer-picture/ Gossipgirlinsider.com] which aired September 1, 2008 on [[The CW]]. On March 10, 2010, her own reality television show created by [[Andrew Glassman]] and Mike Aho{{cite web|first=Robert|last=Seidman|publisher=[[TV by the Numbers]]|date=February 8, 2010|accessdate=October 4, 2014|title=The CW Announces Midseason Debuts of "High Society" and "Fly Girls" |url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/02/08/the-cw-announces-midseason-debuts-of-high-society-and-fly-girls/41449//}} for [[The CW]] called ''[[High Society (2010 TV series)|High Society]]'', starring Mortimer along with other socialites such as [[Paul Johnson Calderon]] and [[Devorah Rose]], first aired. The show documented the lives of Mortimer and her friends in [[New York City]]. Mortimer wrote a novel titled ''Southern Charm'', which follows Minty Davenport from South Carolina to New York, where she is the victim of rumors.[http://www.wwd.com/fashion-news/fashion-scoops/tinsley-by-the-book-5368892 Tinsley Mortimer Pens Debut Novel], ''Women's Wear Daily'', November 15, 2011. Accessed March 17, 2012. It was published by [[Simon & Schuster]] in April 2013.Lipton, Lauren. [https://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/15/fashion/the-return-of-tinsley-mortimer-branding-irons-in-hand.html She's Back, Branding Irons in Hand], ''New York Times', March 13, 2012. Accessed March 17, 2012. Mortimer also contributed a section to the best-selling book ''[[The Park Avenue Diet]]'' [http://www.parkavenuediet.com The Park Avenue Diet. Hatherleigh Press 2008] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120905143446/http://www.parkavenuediet.com/ |date=2012-09-05 }} which outlined recommendations on improving one's conversation and social skills. The book was written by Manhattan diet doctor [[Stuart Fischer]]. In 2014, she launched "Home Collection" manufactured by Pop Culture Living, an e-commerce site featuring curated collections of home accessories.{{Cite web|url=http://www.homeaccentstoday.com/article/493990-e-commerce-venture-pop-culture-living-launches/|title=E-commerce venture Pop Culture Living launches {{!}} Home Accents Today|website=www.homeaccentstoday.com|access-date=2018-09-20}}{{Cite news|url=https://pagesix.com/2016/04/16/the-tragic-downfall-of-new-yorks-hottest-socialite/|title=The tragic downfall of New York’s most glamorous socialite|date=2016-04-17|work=Page Six|access-date=2018-09-20|language=en-US}} She currently has her own line of housewares products sold at [[Bed Bath & Beyond]] and [[Wayfair]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.tinsleymortimer.com/products/|title=Licensed Products {{!}} Tinsley Mortimer|website=www.tinsleymortimer.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-20}} The collection includes dinnerware, decorative glasses, barware and ice buckets. In 2017, Mortimer joined the cast of ''[[The Real Housewives of New York City]]'' for the show's ninth season.http://people.com/tv/real-housewives-new-york-city-tinsley-mortimer/ ==Personal life== Mortimer met Robert Livingston "Topper" Mortimer at [[Lawrenceville School]] and eloped when they were both 18. However, their parents forced them to annul the marriage. On May 4, 2002, they remarried in Richmond, Virginia.Konigsberg, Eric. [https://www.nytimes.com/2007/10/21/fashion/21topper.html?_r=1&scp=2&sq=tinsley+mortimer&st=nyt&oref=login Why Is the Blond Smiling?], ''The New York Times'', October 21, 2007; Accessed September 27, 2009 The Mortimers are now divorced.[http://pagesix.com/2009/01/11/splitsville-5/?_ga=1.3588532.586880044.1375999376 Splitsville?], ''New York Post'', January 11, 2009. Accessed March 16, 2012. On July 23, 2010, Mortimer was featured with her mother Dale on the ''[[Dr. Phil (TV series)|Dr. Phil]]'' show discussing her divorce and her differences with her mother.[http://www.drphil.com/shows/show/1447/ Meddling Moms] Dr. Phil.com, Peteski Productions, July 23, 2009 Her father, George, died March 26, 2015 in Providence, Rhode Island.[http://www.richmond.com/obituaries/mercer-george/article_a87b7e70-559f-584b-8ae0-0b9a93ddc037.html Mercer, George], ''Richmond Times-Dispatch'', March 29, 2015. Accessed 2017. On February 11, 2017, Mortimer was introduced to Chicago-based [[Coupon Cabin]] CEO Scott Kluth by her ''[[RHONY]]'' castmate, [[Carole Radziwill]].{{Cite news|url=http://people.com/tv/rhony-tinsley-mortimer-scott-kluth-dating-couponcabin/|title=RHONY's Tinsley Mortimer Still Dating Coupon Cabin CEO Scott Kluth: 'We're Almost Soul Mates'|work=PEOPLE.com|access-date=2018-02-13|language=en}} The pair dated long distance between New York and Chicago. ==Legal issues== In April 2016, Mortimer was arrested for trespassing in [[Palm Beach, Florida]]. Police were called to a private home after reports of Mortimer screaming on the property. It has been reported that she was warned by authorities to cease similar behavior at the same property the year before when a no contact order was issued against Mortimer. Mortimer was arrested for breaking that order, and later accepted a plea agreement to clean her record.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3533511/Tinsley-Mortimer-40-arrested-trespassing-Palm-Beach-property-screaming.html] The Daily Mail, April 11, 2016 == Filmography == {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" ! colspan="4" style="background:#B0C4DE;" |Filmography |- style="text-align:center;" ! style="background:#ccc;" |Year ! style="background:#ccc;" |Title ! style="background:#ccc;" |Role ! style="background:#ccc;" |Notes |- |2007 |''The Manny'' |Herself |Uncredited |- |2008 |''[[Gossip Girl]]'' |Herself |Episodes: "The Serena Also Rises", "Summer Kind of Wonderful" |- |2009–2011 |''[[The Fashion Show (U.S. TV series)|The Fashion Show]]'' |Herself / Judge |16 episodes |- |2010 |''[[Dr. Phil (talk show)|Dr. Phil]]'' |Herself |Episode: "Meddling Moms" |- |2010 |''[[America's Next Top Model]]'' |Herself |Episode: "New York Women" |- |2010 |''[[High Society (2010 TV series)|High Society]]'' |Herself |Main role; 8 episodes |- |2017–present |''[[The Real Housewives of New York City]]'' |Herself |Main cast member; 43 episodes |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Sources== * Heyman, Marshall. [http://www.harpersbazaar.com/fashion/fashion-articles/tinsley-mortimer-0308 "Blonde Ambition: Tinsley Mortimer"], ''Harper's BAZAAR'', February 20, 2008.
